verses.verse: Better <S%H2896><s%> is a dry <S%H2720><s%> morsel, <S%H6595><s%> and quietness <S%H7962><s%> therewith, than an house <S%H1004><s%> full <S%H4392><s%> of sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> with strife. <S%H7379><s%>

A wise <S%H7919><s%> servant <S%H5650><s%> shall have rule <S%H4910><s%> over a son <S%H1121><s%> that causes shame, <S%H954><s%> and shall have part <S%H2505><s%> of the inheritance <S%H5159><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the brothers. <S%H251><s%>
The fining <S%H4715><s%> pot <S%H4715><s%> is for silver, <S%H3701><s%> and the furnace <S%H3564><s%> for gold: <S%H2091><s%> but the LORD <S%H3068><s%> tries <S%H974><s%> the hearts. <S%H3826><s%>
A wicked <S%H7489><s%> doer gives heed <S%H7181><s%> to false <S%H205><s%> lips; <S%H8193><s%> and a liar <S%H8267><s%> gives ear <S%H238><s%> to a naughty <S%H1942><s%> tongue. <S%H3956><s%>

Whoever mocks <S%H3932><s%> the poor <S%H7326><s%> reproaches <S%H2778><s%> his Maker: <S%H6213><s%> and he that is glad <S%H8056><s%> at calamities <S%H343><s%> shall not be unpunished. <S%H5352><s%>
Children's <S%H1121><s%> children <S%H1121><s%> are the crown <S%H5850><s%> of old <S%H2205><s%> men; and the glory <S%H8597><s%> of children <S%H1121><s%> are their fathers. <S%H1><s%>
Excellent <S%H3499><s%> speech <S%H8193><s%> becomes <S%H5000><s%> not a fool: <S%H5036><s%> much <S%H637><s%> less do lying <S%H8267><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%> a prince. <S%H5081><s%>

A gift <S%H7810><s%> is as a precious <S%H2580><s%> stone <S%H68><s%> in the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of him that has <S%H1167><s%> it: wherever <S%H413><s%> it turns, <S%H6437><s%> it prospers. <S%H7919><s%>

He that covers <S%H3680><s%> a transgression <S%H6588><s%> seeks <S%H1245><s%> love; <S%H160><s%> but he that repeats <S%H8138><s%> a matter <S%H1697><s%> separates <S%H6504><s%> very friends. <S%H441><s%>
A reproof <S%H1606><s%> enters <S%H5181><s%> more into a wise <S%H995><s%> man than an hundred <S%H3967><s%> stripes <S%H5221><s%> into a fool. <S%H3684><s%>
An evil <S%H7451><s%> man seeks <S%H1245><s%> only <S%H389><s%> rebellion: <S%H4805><s%> therefore a cruel <S%H394><s%> messenger <S%H4397><s%> shall be sent <S%H7971><s%> against him.
Let a bear <S%H1677><s%> robbed <S%H7909><s%> of her whelps meet <S%H6298><s%> a man, <S%H376><s%> rather <S%H408><s%> than a fool <S%H3684><s%> in his folly. <S%H200><s%>
Whoever rewards <S%H7725><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> for good, <S%H2896><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> shall not depart <S%H4185><s%> from his house. <S%H1004><s%>

The beginning <S%H7225><s%> of strife <S%H4066><s%> is as when one lets <S%H6362><s%> out water: <S%H4325><s%> therefore leave <S%H5203><s%> off contention, <S%H7379><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> it be meddled <S%H1566><s%> with.

He that justifies <S%H6663><s%> the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> and he that condemns <S%H7561><s%> the just, <S%H6662><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> they both <S%H8147><s%> are abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

Why <S%H4100><s%> <S%H2088><s%> is there a price <S%H4242><s%> in the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> to get <S%H7069><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> seeing he has no <S%H369><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> to it?
A friend <S%H7453><s%> loves <S%H157><s%> at all <S%H3605><s%> times, <S%H6256><s%> and a brother <S%H251><s%> is born <S%H3205><s%> for adversity. <S%H6869><s%>

A man <S%H120><s%> void <S%H2638><s%> of understanding <S%H3820><s%> strikes <S%H8628><s%> hands, <S%H3709><s%> and becomes <S%H6148><s%> surety <S%H6161><s%> in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of his friend. <S%H7453><s%>
He loves <S%H157><s%> transgression <S%H6588><s%> that loves <S%H157><s%> strife: <S%H4683><s%> and he that exalts <S%H1361><s%> his gate <S%H6607><s%> seeks <S%H1245><s%> destruction. <S%H7667><s%>

He that has a fraudulent <S%H6141><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> finds <S%H4672><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> good: <S%H2896><s%> and he that has a perverse <S%H2015><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> into mischief. <S%H7451><s%>
He that begets <S%H3205><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> does it to his sorrow: <S%H8424><s%> and the father <S%H1><s%> of a fool <S%H5036><s%> has no <S%H3808><s%> joy. <S%H8056><s%>
A merry <S%H8056><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> does good <S%H3190><s%> like a medicine: <S%H1456><s%> but a broken <S%H5218><s%> spirit <S%H7307><s%> dries <S%H3001><s%> the bones. <S%H1634><s%>
A wicked <S%H7563><s%> man takes <S%H3947><s%> a gift <S%H7810><s%> out of the bosom <S%H2436><s%> to pervert <S%H5186><s%> the ways <S%H734><s%> of judgment. <S%H4941><s%>

Wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is before <S%H854><s%> <S%H6440><s%> him that has understanding; <S%H995><s%> but the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> are in the ends <S%H7097><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>
A foolish <S%H3684><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> is a grief <S%H3708><s%> to his father, <S%H1><s%> and bitterness <S%H4470><s%> to her that bore <S%H3205><s%> him.
Also <S%H1571><s%> to punish <S%H6064><s%> the just <S%H6662><s%> is not good, <S%H2896><s%> nor to strike <S%H5221><s%> princes <S%H5081><s%> for equity. <S%H3476><s%>
He that has knowledge <S%H1847><s%> spares <S%H2820><s%> his words: <S%H561><s%> and a man <S%H376><s%> of understanding <S%H8394><s%> is of an excellent <S%H7119><s%> spirit. <S%H7307><s%>

Even <S%H1571><s%> a fool, <S%H191><s%> when he holds <S%H2790><s%> his peace, <S%H2790><s%> is counted <S%H2803><s%> wise: <S%H2450><s%> and he that shuts <S%H331><s%> his lips <S%H8193><s%> is esteemed a man of understanding. <S%H995><s%>
